at link
http://www.geocities.com/icecuberh/Projects/ConfigurableHibernateAppender/ConfigurableHibernateAppender.zip

You can download my work in zip file
At present You'll Find:

directory src - source files

Configurable Hibernate Appender.odt - very very limited documentation

ConfigurableHibernateAppender.jar - binary distribution

eclipse.userlibraries - list of the dependencies in eclipse userlibraries format

HibernateAppenderCreateTabelMsSQLServer2K5.sql - SQl script for creating db
tables exported from M$ Sql Server 2005 so i think it's not very portable

ConfigurableHibernateAppender.jardesc - eclipse export to jar configuration
I used some generics so You need JDK 5.... for now that's all Folks!!!

Comments:

1.  Name the appender HibernateAppender.  Names need to be short to make things
easier on users.
2.  Code and comments need to be in English and code formatted in the Log4J
style, e.g. 2-space indent.
3.  Test needs to be a JUnit test.
4.  I think it's a fairly large number of files for what it does.  E.g.
DBAppender fits into a single class.  Why can't this?  Your contribution is
about 10-20 files.

Suggestions:

1.  Create an appender that obatains the Hibernate session from JNDI or from a
factory.  Supply a simple factory.
2.  I don't see why LoggingEvent couldn't be rendered using an .hbxml?  

Thanks for the contribution.  Hopefully somebody can use this as a basis for a
better integrated Log4j appender.
creator: genman@noderunner.net
carnold@apache.org
text:
There could be a decent amount of Apache process involved in integrating this into the log4j project 
itself if it is the work of more than one developer.  To bring it into log4j (likely through an intermediary 
sandbox project), we'd want to have a reasonable expectation that it would continue to be developed in 
Logging Services and not be either a drop of an abandoned code base or a branch of code that 
continues to evolve externally.  If you are still interested in pursuing a contribution of this code, the 
scope of it such that having a Contributors License Agreement (http://www.apache.org/licenses) on file 
would be highly desirable and the submission should follow the requirements on http://
www.apache.org/legal/src-headers.html.

Alternatively, the log4j web site could list this appender in the list of third-party appenders.

In addition, perhaps it would be better to have a PersistenceAdapter that would abstract the common 
elements of an Hibernate, iBatis, et al based appender.
